sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of consumer behavior occurring in a market
message_1: In a store, there are 300 customers who visit on a particular day. Out of these customers, 45% of them make a purchase. If a randomly selected customer is observed, what is the probability that they will make a purchase?
message_2:
To find the probability that a randomly selected customer will make a purchase, we can simply use the percentage of customers who make a purchase.

Since 45% of the customers make a purchase, the probability that a randomly selected customer will make a purchase is 45% or 0.45 (as a decimal).
